last_episode_to_air.name: Pancakes
last_episode_to_air.overview: On the day of their wedding, Jimmy and Gretchen grapple with the meaning of marriage.

name: You're the Worst
overview: Narcissistic, brash, and self-destructive Jimmy Shive-Overly thinks all relationships are doomed. Cynical, people-pleasing, and stubborn Gretchen Cutler knows that relationships aren't for her. So when they meet at a wedding, it's only natural that the two of them go home together.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview: Meet Gretchen and Jimmy. She's a cynical PR rep and he's a narcissistic British novelist. Impressed by each other's bad behavior at Jimmy's ex-girlfriend's wedding, they begin what they swear is a casual sexual relationship—until it turns out to be more than that.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: In Season 2, Jimmy and Gretchen are forced to take their relationship to the next level by moving in together.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview: After a whirlwind courtship and rough post-cohabitation period, Jimmy and Gretchen try to keep the good times rolling while confronting the f-word—“family”.

seasons.name: Season 4
seasons.overview: Season four kicks off after Gretchen accepted Jimmy's marriage proposal, only to see him leave her stranded in the Hollywood Hills after he freaked out that she would be his family. Now broken up and involved with other people, Jimmy and Gretchen struggle to move on while constantly being pulled back toward one another.

tagline: Terrible people. Perfect for each other.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Gretchen find themselves falling for each other despite their better judgment.

episodes.name: Insouciance
episodes.overview: Jimmy attempts to take Gretchen on a date.

episodes.name: Keys Open Doors
episodes.overview: Gretchen inadvertently asks Jimmy for a key to his house.

episodes.name: What Normal People Do
episodes.overview: Gretchen makes Jimmy come over to her disaster of an apartment.

episodes.name: Sunday Funday
episodes.overview: Jimmy begrudgingly joins Gretchen, Edgar, and Lindsay on a "Sunday Funday."

episodes.name: PTSD
episodes.overview: After Jimmy accidentally sleeps with an A-List celebrity, he and Gretchen embark on a sex arms race to even out their score.

episodes.name: Equally Dead Inside
episodes.overview: Jimmy opens up emotionally, which completely freaks Gretchen out.

episodes.name: Finish Your Milk
episodes.overview: Jimmy meets Gretchen's parents.

episodes.name: Constant Horror and Bone-Deep Dissatisfaction
episodes.overview: An episode spanning the course of nearly three years, we see the events that lead up to Gretchen and Jimmy meeting.

episodes.name: Fists and Feet and Stuff
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Gretchen take their relationship to the next level.

1.name: Season 1
1.overview: Meet Gretchen and Jimmy. She's a cynical PR rep and he's a narcissistic British novelist. Impressed by each other's bad behavior at Jimmy's ex-girlfriend's wedding, they begin what they swear is a casual sexual relationship—until it turns out to be more than that.

episodes.name: The Sweater People
episodes.overview: Although they're now living together, Jimmy and Gretchen try to avoid domesticity by partying all the time -- a lifestyle that's harder than it looks. Meanwhile, Edgar is smitten with Lindsay, who attempts a desperate reconciliation with Paul.

episodes.name: Crevasses
episodes.overview: Gretchen, realizing she doesn’t really have any adult belongings, takes the gang on a trip to the mall. Jimmy uses this opportunity to gain some writing inspiration. Meanwhile, a newly single Lindsay recruits a hesitant Edgar to help her pick up guys.

episodes.name: Born Dead
episodes.overview: Gretchen makes an attempt to reconnect with her old group of friends by throwing herself a housewarming party. Jimmy does his best to affirm his belief that friends are for babies. Edgar continues his pursuit of Lindsay, and Lindsay meets her estranged husband’s new girlfriend.

episodes.name: All About That Paper
episodes.overview: Jimmy spends the day with an eccentric author on a day-long job interview. Gretchen deals with a work crisis. Edgar discovers the magic of improv comedy. And Lindsay gets served with divorce papers.

episodes.name: We Can Do Better Than This
episodes.overview: Jimmy questions his ability as a writer but finally zeroes in on his next project. Meanwhile, Gretchen and Lindsay discover all they do is talk about men and set out to change the status-quo. Edgar gets close to his improv teacher, Dorothy.

episodes.name: Side Bitch
episodes.overview: Jimmy discovers Gretchen's been sneaking out of the house at night and suspects she's having an affair. Lindsay's life spirals as she discovers she doesn't know how to live on her own. Edgar takes Dorothy out on a date.

episodes.name: There Is Not Currently a Problem
episodes.overview: The group tries to get rid of a mouse in Jimmy's house; Gretchen finally opens up to Jimmy.

episodes.name: Spooky Sunday Funday
episodes.overview: Jimmy tries to stealthily help Gretchen with her depression by planning a Halloween-themed Sunday Funday.

episodes.name: LCD Soundsystem
episodes.overview: Gretchen becomes fascinated by a slightly older, cool couple that appears to have it all. Jimmy employs a punishment-based system to ensure he meets his writing deadline.

episodes.name: A Right Proper Story
episodes.overview: Jimmy’s trashy family comes to visit from England, much to Jimmy’s dismay. In the throes of her depression, Gretchen struggles to help Jimmy entertain them. Lindsay fills in for Gretchen at work. Edgar bonds with Jimmy’s little sister.

episodes.name: A Rapidly Mutating Virus
episodes.overview: Jimmy gets closer to his bartender friend, Nina. Gretchen accompanies Sam to do a radio interview. Edgar attempts to make inroads with Dorothy's comedy friends.

episodes.name: Other Things You Could Be Doing
episodes.overview: Gretchen’s depression comes to a head, forcing Jimmy to make a tough choice. Lindsay finally lets Paul go. Edgar has his improv graduation show.

episodes.name: The Heart Is a Dumb Dumb
episodes.overview: Jimmy attends Becca and Vernon’s baby gender reveal party. Gretchen takes care of some unfinished business. Edgar and Dorothy’s relationship reaches a turning point. Lindsay confronts Paul.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: In Season 2, Jimmy and Gretchen are forced to take their relationship to the next level by moving in together.

episodes.name: Try Real Hard
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Gretchen adjust to life after saying I love you. Edgar and Dorothy have sexual problems. Lindsay and Paul start a new hobby.

episodes.name: Fix Me, Dummy
episodes.overview: Gretchen starts therapy; Jimmy's confidence wavers; Lindsay neglects a bedridden Paul.

episodes.name: Bad News: Dude's Dead
episodes.overview: Everyone comes together to break some big news to Jimmy.

episodes.name: Men Get Strong
episodes.overview: Gretchen helps Jimmy process a tragedy. Lindsay decides she wants to be a good mom.

episodes.name: Twenty-Two
episodes.overview: Edgar spends the day trying to find some relief for his PTSD.

episodes.name: The Last Sunday Funday
episodes.overview: The gang embark on a very special Sunday Funday.

episodes.name: The Only Thing That Helps
episodes.overview: Gretchen and Jimmy hold an unconventional funeral. Paul struggles to give Lindsay what she needs sexually. Edgar takes a stand against the VA.

episodes.name: Genetically Inferior Beta Males
episodes.overview: Gretchen parents her friends with mixed results. Jimmy does Vernon’s podcast. Edgar embarks on an alternative therapy. Lindsay pushes Paul too far.

episodes.name: The Seventh Layer
episodes.overview: Vernon and Paul take a road trip.

episodes.name: Talking to Me, Talking to Me
episodes.overview: Jimmy builds a tree house. Gretchen accompanies Lindsay during a potentially emotional event. Edgar's professional life flourishes to Dorothy's dismay.

episodes.name: The Inherent, Unsullied Qualitative Value of Anything
episodes.overview: At a wedding together for the first time since the day they met, Jimmy and Gretchen's tensions come to a head. Edgar's relationship is jeopardized by his newfound success. Lindsay is forced to come clean to Paul.

episodes.name: You Knew It Was a Snake
episodes.overview: The three couples engage in day-long fights.

episodes.name: No Longer Just Us
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Gretchen investigate a murder site. Lindsay sees a new side of Paul. Edgar makes a sacrifice with unforeseen consequences.

3.name: Season 3
3.overview: After a whirlwind courtship and rough post-cohabitation period, Jimmy and Gretchen try to keep the good times rolling while confronting the f-word—“family”.

episodes.name: It's Been (1)
episodes.overview: After proposing to Gretchen and immediately abandoning her on a hilltop, Jimmy has gone into hiding in the middle of nowhere in an attempt to escape reality. Reality does not comply.

episodes.name: It's Been (2)
episodes.overview: Gretchen takes the first baby steps toward reconstructing her life as Edgar and Lindsay struggle to find normalcy in their new post‐Jimmy/Gretchen world.

episodes.name: Odysseus
episodes.overview: After Jimmy returns to Los Angeles, he attempts to make amends with Gretchen, leading to their first confrontation. Lindsay and Edgar enjoy their new friends‐with‐benefits arrangement while Edgar tries to show Jimmy that Gretchen wasn’t the only person he abandoned.

episodes.name: This Is Just Marketing
episodes.overview: Jimmy learns that his literary novel is being marketed as erotica. While doing Vernon’s podcast, Gretchen realizes she’s been letting Jimmy off easy. When Edgar and Lindsay babysit Tallulah, Lindsay learns for the first time that she’s capable of love and Edgar tries a new technique to pick up women.

episodes.name: Fog of War, Bro
episodes.overview: Gretchen has moved back into the house and plays mind games with Jimmy, sabotaging his first interview for the new book. Seeing an opportunity in Gretchen’s return to the house, Edgar and Lindsay plot to get Jimmy and Gretchen back together.

episodes.name: There's Always a Back Door
episodes.overview: Edgar takes Jimmy on a “man date” in an effort to emotionally bond with him while Gretchen discovers some startling news about the new guy she’s seeing. Lindsay attempts to make friends at work.

episodes.name: Not a Great Bet
episodes.overview: Gretchen goes home for the birth of her brother’s baby, but instead ends up reconnecting with a friend from her past, who inadvertently reveals why Jimmy may have left her.

episodes.name: A Bunch of Hornballs
episodes.overview: Jimmy goes out of town for a Romance/Erotica fiction convention while Gretchen throws a divorce for Lindsay, leading to an unintended deepening of Gretchen’s relationship with Boone. Meanwhile, Edgar’s friend Max encourages him to overspend on party planning.

episodes.name: Worldstar!
episodes.overview: Lindsay's mom comes to town, shedding light on the origin of Lindsay's issues, while Jimmy attempts to get over Gretchen by hooking up with someone from his past. Meanwhile, Edgar struggles to reconcile his new writer life with his old veteran life.

episodes.name: Dad-Not-Dad
episodes.overview: Jimmy spends a day with a woman from his past and attempts to fit in with her friends while Gretchen attempts to impress Boone’s ex‐wife. Lindsay reconnects to a former father figure and Edgar, prompted by Max, buys a fancy car he can’t afford.

episodes.name: From the Beginning, I Was Screwed
episodes.overview: Gretchen participates in a family tradition with Boone and his daughter while Jimmy competes on an NPR game show in an attempt to regain some literary cred. Lindsay’s desire to help people leads her back into Paul’s orbit, and Edgar attempts to deepen his friendship with Max.

episodes.name: Like People
episodes.overview: Gretchen spends the day with Boone and his daughter in an attempt to distract herself from having slept with Jimmy the previous night, while Jimmy tries to prove to himself he’s moved on. Lindsay attempts to save Olivia from getting too close to the unreliable Gretchen, and Edgar trails Max to figure out why they’re no longer writing partners.

episodes.name: It's Always Been This Way
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Gretchen go for a long drive to force a conclusion on the confusing state of their relationship. Edgar finds closure with Max while Lindsay figures out a way to solve Becca, Vernon, and Paul’s problems all at once.

4.name: Season 4
4.overview: Season four kicks off after Gretchen accepted Jimmy's marriage proposal, only to see him leave her stranded in the Hollywood Hills after he freaked out that she would be his family. Now broken up and involved with other people, Jimmy and Gretchen struggle to move on while constantly being pulled back toward one another.

episodes.name: The Intransigence of Love
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Gretchen tell the story of their love to a prospective wedding planner.

episodes.name: The Pin In My Grenade
episodes.overview: Jimmy and Gretchen reveal that they're forgoing a traditional wedding, opting instead for a Courthouse elopement.

episodes.name: The One Thing We Don't Talk About
episodes.overview: Jimmy challenges Gretchen to tackle some of the responsibilities that come with being an adult.

episodes.name: What Money?
episodes.overview: Jimmy unexpectedly receives a large advance and must fend off all his “friends” who just want a piece of the pie.

episodes.name: A Very Good Boy
episodes.overview: Jimmy attempts to prove that, despite being on the verge of becoming a married man, he has not lost his edge. Edgar and Lindsay attempt to go on a real date.

episodes.name: This Brief Fermata
episodes.overview: Jimmy “gifts” Gretchen a week of no-strings-attached sex.

episodes.name: Zero Eggplants
episodes.overview: Gretchen and Jimmy make “couple friends.”

episodes.name: The Pillars of Creation
episodes.overview: Paul, Vernon, and Becca air their dirty laundry on a weekend getaway.

episodes.name: Bachelor/Bachelorette Party Sunday Funday
episodes.overview: Edgar and Lindsay plan the most epic Sunday Funday yet.

episodes.name: Magical Thinking
episodes.overview: Gretchen’s anxiety comes to the surface at a major event she’s organized for her new client.

episodes.name: Four Goddamn More Days
episodes.overview: Gretchen maintains an elaborate act of deception while Jimmy prepares for the big day.

episodes.name: We Were Having Such a Nice Day
episodes.overview: The day before the wedding, Gretchen’s mom comes to town and Edgar takes Jimmy on an epic best-man date.

episodes.name: Pancakes
episodes.overview: On the day of their wedding, Jimmy and Gretchen grapple with the meaning of marriage.
